definitions.definition: To manipulate objects, such as balls , clubs , beanbags , rings , etc. in an artful or artistic manner. Juggling may also include assorted other circus skills such as the diabolo , devil sticks , hat , and cigar box manipulation as well.
To handle or manage many tasks at once.
examples: He juggled home, school, and work for two years.

definitions.definition: To deceive by trick or artifice .
examples: I think they are juggling the company's books.

main_definition: To manipulate objects, such as balls , clubs , beanbags , rings , etc. in an artful or artistic manner. Juggling may also include assorted other circus skills such as the diabolo , devil sticks , hat , and cigar box manipulation as well.
secondary_definitions: To handle or manage many tasks at once.
( ambitransitive ) To deceive by trick or artifice .
( intransitive , archaic ) To joke or jest .
( intransitive , archaic ) To perform magic tricks .
